snippet: Several commencement speakers this spring advocated tolerance in the wake of protests that drummed away others who had been invited.
abstract: College commencement speakers for 2014 ceremonies have made news mostly by their absence in the face of student protests over speaker selections; those who have appeared on podiums have consistently expressed disapproval over the protests, warning against political orthodoxy and insisting that principle of airing opposing views should always trump objections to a particular speaker; excerpts from a number of ceremonies highlighted.
lead_paragraph: Several commencement speakers this spring advocated tolerance in the wake of protests that drummed away others who had been invited.

headline.main: Graduates Cautioned: Don’t Shut Out Opposing Views
headline.print_headline: Graduates Cautioned: Don’t Shut Out Opposing Views
